articles.headline: Young Israelis Held in Attack on Arabs
articles.snippet: The assault on several young Palestinians raises concerns that the poisoned political divide is affecting some Israeli youths.
articles.abstract: The assault on several young Palestinians raises concerns that the poisoned political divide is affecting some Israeli youths.
articles.lead_paragraph: JERUSALEM — Seven Israeli teenagers were in custody on Monday, accused of what a police official and several witnesses described as an attempted lynching of several Palestinian youths, laying bare the undercurrent of tension in this ethnically mixed but politically divided city. A 15-year-old suspect standing outside court said, “For my part he can die, he’s an Arab.”

articles.headline: G.O.P. Trying to Oust Akin From Race for Rape Remarks
articles.snippet: Republicans unleashed a furious campaign to drive Representative Todd Akin out of the Senate race in Missouri, but he said that he would not drop out.
articles.abstract: Republicans unleashed a furious campaign to drive Representative Todd Akin out of the Senate race in Missouri, but he said that he would not drop out.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — Fearing that a seat crucial to winning a Senate majority could slip away, the national Republican establishment on Monday unleashed a furious campaign to drive Representative Todd Akin, the party’s newly selected nominee, out of the race against Missouri’s Democratic senator.
articles.byline: By Jonathan Weisman and John Eligon

articles.headline: Apple Becomes the Most Valuable Public Company Ever, With an Asterisk
articles.snippet: Apple already boasts the largest current market value of any public company. On Monday it became the most highly valued public company ever, breaking the record for the highest market capitalization set by Microsoft. But Microsoft still holds the ...
articles.abstract: Apple already boasts the largest current market value of any public company. On Monday it became the most highly valued public company ever, breaking the record for the highest market capitalization set by Microsoft. But Microsoft still holds the record when its 1999 value is adjusted for inflation.

articles.headline: Clash of Cultures Upends Spain’s Cajas
articles.snippet: In Spain, the time-honored tradition of the savings bank, or caja, as a baronial community institution came into conflict with a modern, euro-based banking economy.
articles.abstract: In Spain, the time-honored tradition of the savings bank, or caja, as a baronial community institution came into conflict with a modern, euro-based banking economy.
articles.lead_paragraph: VIGO, SPAIN — In the manner of an earlier, more courtly style of Spanish banking, he liked to be called Don Julio by his employees and the businessmen and government officials here in the city where he was born.

articles.headline: Investors in Health Care Seem to Bet on Incumbent
articles.snippet: Despite public support for Mitt Romney, many businessmen and investors are wagering more than rhetoric on President Obama.
articles.abstract: Despite public support for Mitt Romney, many businessmen and investors are wagering more than rhetoric on President Obama.
articles.lead_paragraph: Who is going to win the presidential election?

articles.headline: Facebook’s Ambition Collides With Harsh Market
articles.snippet: The challenge for Facebook, which is worth just over half of what it was three months ago, is to convince Wall Street that it has a real plan for making money.
articles.abstract: The challenge for Facebook, which is worth just over half of what it was three months ago, is to convince Wall Street that it has a real plan for making money.
articles.lead_paragraph: MENLO PARK, Calif. — Inside Facebook’s headquarters, a red-and-white poster affixed to a wall asks bluntly: “What Could Go Wrong?”

articles.headline: Regulator Says Broker Audits Fail to Include Required Work
articles.snippet: The Public Company Accounting Oversight Board said that it had found deficiencies in every audit of brokerage firms that it had reviewed.
articles.abstract: The Public Company Accounting Oversight Board said that it had found deficiencies in every audit of brokerage firms that it had reviewed.
articles.lead_paragraph: The many auditors who inspect the financial statements of brokerage firms appear to be cutting corners and not doing all the work they should do, a worrisome sign after the collapse of the Peregrine Financial Group, a leading commodities brokerage firm, where a fraud had gone undetected for many years.

articles.headline: Life With Syria’s Rebels in a Cold and Cunning War
articles.snippet: A rebel group presents a cross-section of a nation in upheaval – an accountant, real estate agent, farmers and laborers who have taken up arms believing their time has come.
articles.abstract: A rebel group presents a cross-section of a nation in upheaval – an accountant, real estate agent, farmers and laborers who have taken up arms believing their time has come.
articles.lead_paragraph: TAL RIFAAT, Syria — Abdul Hakim Yasin, the commander of a Syrian antigovernment fighting group, lurched his pickup truck to a stop inside the captured residential compound he uses as his guerrilla base.

articles.headline: Cardiologist Issues Alert on St. Jude Heart Device
articles.snippet: Dr. Robert Hauser says that a material used by St. Jude in a defibrillator that connects to a patient’s heart may be breaking down prematurely.
articles.abstract: Dr. Robert Hauser says that a material used by St. Jude in a defibrillator that connects to a patient’s heart may be breaking down prematurely.
articles.lead_paragraph: A cardiologist who studies the safety of heart devices said surgeons should stop using a component sold by St. Jude Medical until more is known about the long-term safety of the device.
articles.byline: By Barry Meier and Katie Thomas
